content: What popular board game, first published in 1935, involves buying and trading properties based on real streets in Atlantic City?

The popular board game you're referring to is Monopoly. It was first published by Parker Brothers in 1935 and is based on the economic concept of rent. The game's properties are named after actual locations in Atlantic City, New Jersey, USA. In Monopoly, players roll dice to move around the game board, buying and trading properties, and developing them with houses and hotels with the goal of driving their opponents into bankruptcy.Over the years, Monopoly has become one of the best-selling board games worldwide, with numerous editions and variations reflecting different themes, regions, and licensed properties.
